thread.section_title: iDriveSafely Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of iDriveSafely | www.idrivesafely.com
thread.title: VICTOR E.

author: VICTOR E.
title: VICTOR E.
text: Easy to follow course with lots of excellent tips and advice. I have used the 10/2 driving position but am learning the 4/8 as shown in the course.Its little hard to adapt after so many years of the other but it makes sense. The one thing I would add is to keep the wheels pointing straight ahead in a left turn until you are ready to make the turn otherwise if you are hit from behind you will be pushed into oncoming traffic
